item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, January 28, 2025 at 7:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. We're bringing Pebble back (1716 points | 403 comments)
2. Machine Learning in Production (CMU Course) (209 points | 15 comments)
3. Turning the Database Inside-Out (43 points | 8 comments)
4. Human corpses keep moving for over a year after death, scientist says (2019) (17 points | 10 comments)
5. Google open-sources the Pebble OS (967 points | 148 comments)
6. How we scaled Slack to support 1000s of developers (96 points | 35 comments)
7. The Taylorator – All Your Frequencies Are Belong to Us (270 points | 83 comments)
8. Undiagnosed Cognitive Decline Eats into Seniors' Retirement Savings (5 points | 1 comment)
9. The Alpha Myth: How captive wolves led us astray (208 points | 187 comments)
10. Go 1.24's go tool is one of the best additions to the ecosystem in years (188 points | 77 comments)
11. Google Maps to Rename 'Gulf of Mexico' to 'Gulf of America' (10 points | discuss)
12. The Vikings also used crampons to avoid slipping on ice (29 points | 13 comments)
13. Using AI for Coding: My Journey with Cline and LLMs (137 points | 55 comments)
14. The Illustrated DeepSeek-R1 (258 points | 41 comments)
15. DeepSeek releases Janus Pro, a text-to-image generator [pdf] (743 points | 567 comments)
16. Dragonsweeper — A minesweeper game that requires observation (92 points | 37 comments)
17. Facebook ban on discussing Linux? (566 points | 268 comments)
18. Complexity physics finds crucial tipping points in chess games (39 points | 13 comments)
19. My failed attempt to shrink all NPM packages by 5% (314 points | 207 comments)
20. Nvidia’s $589B DeepSeek rout (364 points | 766 comments)
21. The ocean teems with networks of interconnected bacteria (105 points | 17 comments)
22. Oliver Heaviside and the theory of transmission lines (2021) (239 points | 70 comments)
23. Show HN: I Made an iOS Podcast Player with Racket (192 points | 71 comments)
24. A 20-Year-Old Small Company (28 points | 11 comments)
25. Bilinear down/upsampling, aligning pixel grids, and that infamous GPU half pixel (2021) (114 points | 16 comments)
26. Open-R1: an open reproduction of DeepSeek-R1 (6 points | discuss)
27. Show HN: I Created ErisForge, a Python Library for Abliteration of LLMs (113 points | 43 comments)
28. A Faster Quantum Fourier Transform (67 points | 6 comments)
29. SiFive's P550 Microarchitecture (150 points | 56 comments)
30. Operation Leg – a pilot unlike any other (2020) (166 points | 71 comments)
